meanings.definition: The amount that can be held or taken into the mouth at one time.
meanings.sent1: He took a big mouthful of water from the fountain.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't speak because her mouth was full of a mouthful of popcorn.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a whole apple in his mouth was quite a mouthful!
meanings.sent4: The story she told was a mouthful of secrets waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The spicy chili was a mouthful of flavors exploding in his mouth.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase that is difficult to pronounce or say.
meanings.sent1: The foreign name was a mouthful for the students to say.
meanings.sent2: The scientific term was a mouthful for the young children to pronounce.
meanings.sent3: The tongue-twister was a fun mouthful to challenge their pronunciation.
meanings.sent4: Her last name was a mouthful that always caused confusion.
meanings.sent5: The ancient language had many mouthfuls that required practice to say correctly.

meanings.definition: A small amount of food or drink.
meanings.sent1: He only had a mouthful of soup left in his bowl.
meanings.sent2: She offered him a mouthful of the delicious dessert she made.
meanings.sent3: The tiny cupcake was a sweet mouthful of joy.
meanings.sent4: The sip of tea was a comforting mouthful on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The bite of the spicy taco was a flavorful mouthful that left him wanting more.
